Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,104Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 2

Circulation thrums directly against Clark’s chest, strong arms clinging to his neck, as if holding onto a lifeline that Bruce knows wouldn’t snap. entry.title: I Know You’re Tired, Well I’m Tired Too
entry.summary:
Author: Kingiic

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,388Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Light. All consuming and wet. The chords of blackness receded from the peripherals of his vision. Nothing remained of the evidence. The beast from seconds ago was nothing more than a literal stain on Gordon’s white button up. And Light; totally absolute in its buzzing heat. Gordon lifted his arm to shield his eyes from the beams. In an instant, the light dulled. Gordon took a moment to rub his eyes and readjust himself before looking at the six-foot bat signal pointing directly at him. Perched on the metal neck, standing just behind the dimmed light, stood the half-illuminated silhouette of the Batman. “We need to talk.” Began the familiar voice, low and stern. “Are you functional?” _______________ Someone is making clones of this world’s most powerful individuals, Gotham is battling fascism and corruption in the midst of a mayoral race, and Batman must learn how to fight fire with fire, or he’ll have to make a few new friends.

entry.title: Sun Starved
entry.summary:
Author: Fish_stik

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,353Chapters: 6/?Kudos: 59

Summary: Bruce had just been patrolling one night. That's all. Nothing world-ending (not that Alfred knew about his nightly ventures—which itself might be Bruce-ending), and yet here he was. Dragged to some backwater summer camp for "half-bloods" by a young woman after helping her fight off some weird meta thug, where everyone took Ancient Greek myths far too seriously. Don't get him wrong, he loved those stories; he basically grew up on them, but there was no way that this was all real.   Like, come on... A half-horse activities director? Magical strawberry fields? It was all too much, and that was coming from the guy from a city overrun with metas and who lived right next door to the place with an alien as its hero. Though Bruce didn't know or even trust the guy (?), Superman made far more sense than these demigods.  Bruce fights a minotaur with Diana and gets dragged to Camp Half-Blood, where he then finds out he’s a demigod, makes a very attractive friend, and finds out the sun has been stolen. What a killer summer…

entry.title: Through blue lens
entry.summary:
Author: wwlynx

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,376Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 12

Summary: The most vulnerable he has ever been, was kept reserved sacred for Clark’s iris- and Clark’s only. Gentle honest eyes, easy apologies and a wry smile that held the world. Perhaps was how loving he was- easy smiles and shiny eyes. Soft spoken words. Gentle touches- mere pats on the shoulders, shared glances. Bruce couldn’t stop. Couldn’t place. Couldn’t control. Bruce Wayne was a selfish bastard wishing, wanting, desiring and hoping.Clark Kent was kind, loyal and saw a friend in him- Clark who saw beyond the man in the mask, beyond Wayne.

entry.title: Miss the Mark
entry.summary:
Author: elihinata

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 12,558Chapters: 3/6Kudos: 207

Summary: Clark Kent has never shaken the feeling that he doesn’t quite belong. He grew up learning to hide—his strength, his heritage, his very self—all to protect a secret that kept him at arm’s length from everyone around him. But nothing made him feel more alone than discovering the one thing his Kryptonian biology denied him: a soulmate. While every human carried a mark guiding them to someone meant just for them, Clark carried nothing. No promise. No destined other. The more time passes, the heavier that truth becomes, aching under his skin until it finally breaks him. One night, overwhelmed by longing and starved for a connection he fears he’ll never have, Clark gives in to a single reckless impulse. He kisses the one person he trusts most in this world—his best friend, Bruce Wayne.

entry.title: The Protection Agreement
entry.summary:
Author: Nacrestack

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,963Chapters: 9/?Kudos: 149

Summary: Superman has finally had enough. It has been far too long for him to not reveal his identity. When he commits to outing himself to the JL he'll have to contend with the ever cautious Batman. Little does Clark know, Batman isn't nearly as opposed as he seems and Batman might have a secret of his own to share.Too bad everything goes wrong as soon as Batman starts to open up. Clark is sure he'll never learn more about his best friend after this giant mess.

entry.title: Now This House is a Home
entry.summary:
Author: batoclock

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,009Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 62

Summary: “Tim sweetheart please, you need to eat even if Papa isn’t here right now, " Bruce tried to convince his second youngest, currently seated in the high chair throwing a temper tantrum at eight in the morning on a Monday all because Clark wasn't home. Tim was throwing the porridge at Bruce’s shirt he just changed into, his face red from screaming and tears were running down his chubby cheeks. "Papa!!! I want Papa!!!” The toddler was screaming on top of his lungs. Bruce was sure Damian was going to wake up if he didn’t get Tim to calm down and eat his food in peace. “I know sweetheart but Papa isn’t here right now, but he will be back soon and then you get your Papa all to yourself.” That just made the toddler even more furious and if Bruce didn’t have years of experience and training as Batman under his belt the next load of porridge aimed at him by his second youngest would have hit him square in the face. Just some married superbat with the batkids snippets my brain came up with.
